item.title: Parts list for the ARM cluster
item.description: ARM Cluster Parts List Realized I forgot to include a parts list for the cluster in my ARM cluster post (all prices are as of March 3rd, 2019), so here we go. Three Odroid HC2 ARM SBCs. $54.95. These have gigabit ethernet ports, a SATA-3 port for 3.5 inch or 2.5 inch HDD/SSD drives, Samsung Exynos5422 Cortex-A15 2Ghz and Cortex-A7 Octa core 32bit ARM CPUs, with four 2GHz cores and four 1.

item.title: Getting an ARM kubernetes cluster up and running
item.description: Background I recently decided to set up a Kubernetes cluster in my basement, partly because I’d never set a cluster up from scratch by myself, and partly because my existing NAS was beginning to run out of headroom. For a variety of reasons, I decided to use ODROID HC2 boards. They’ve got gigabit ethernet, eight CPU cores, 2 GB RAM and a SATA-3 port for directly connecting a hard drive, which I wanted so I could use them as file server bricks.

I’m an SRE in Denver. I like cooking, photography, and working on distributed infrastructure. I’m the organizer for Denver CoffeeOps, which currently meets every Thursday morning from 8am to 10am at the Monk and Mongoose in Greenwood Village near DTC. I have a variety of DevOps (and DevOOPs) themed swag on redbubble, if you’d like to buy something and contribute to my hardware habit, or you can contribute at https://www.patreon.com/unixorn.
Email me at jpb @ unixorn.net. I’m curiousbiped on twitter, unixorn on redbubble and apeseekingknowledge on instagram.
